metadata.title: CVE-2023-36824 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Redis is an in-memory database that persists on disk. In Redit 7.0 prior to7.0.12, extracting key names from a command and a list of arguments may, insome cases, trigger a heap overflow and result in reading random heapmemory, heap corruption and potentially remote code execution. Severalscenarios that may lead to authenticated users executing a speciallycrafted `COMMAND GETKEYS` or `COMMAND GETKEYSANDFLAGS`and authenticatedusers who were set with ACL rules that match key names, executing aspecially crafted command that refers to a variadic list of key names. Thevulnerability is patched in Redis 7.0.12.

criterions.comment: redis package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
